intro: Pilosella ericetorum, commonly known as the alpine hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Pilosella ericetorum is often found in open meadows and on limestone slopes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
